availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

person.persName: Thomas Perry McGlone (Carter County, Kentucky, farmer and soldier.)

body.p: Carter County, Kentucky, farmer and soldier. Carter County, Kentucky, native. Son of James McGlone and Elizabeth Stone McGlone. Resident of Carter County in 1850. Farm hand in Carter County in 1860. Farmer in Carter County in 1863. Served in 40th Kentucky Volunteer Mounted Infantry (U.S.A) as a corporal from September 28, 1863 to December 30, 1864.

ab.bibl:
Seventh Manuscript Census of the United States (1850), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Carter County, District No 2, p. 230A-B.
Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Carter County, p. 158.
Ninth Manuscript Census of the United States (1870), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Carter County, Precinct No 2, p. 108A.
Eleventh Manuscript Census of the United States (1890), Veterans Schedules, Kentucky, Carter County, District No 2, p. 2.
Report of the Adjutant General of the State of Kentucky, vol. 2, 1861-1866 (Frankfort: Kentucky Yeoman Office, 1866), p. 432.
Robert E. McGlone and Thomas H. McGlone, The McGlones: A Series on the McGlone Name as Researched in the United States, (McGlone and Associates, 1980), p. 67.
"Thomas Perry McGlone (1842-1903)," Find A Grave, Memorial 92561009, accessed June 28, 2022, http://www.findagrave.com/memorial/92561009.
